Package project2

Class AccountDatabase

java.lang.Object
project2.AccountDatabase
public class AccountDatabase
extends java.lang.Object
The account database class is a blue print of an object whose main property is an array of accounts. This class provides the functionality to work with the different kinds of accounts in an AccountDatabase object.
Author:
Vaishnavi Manthena, Sanjana Pendharkar

  • Field Details

    • accounts

      private Account[] accounts

    • size

      private int size

  • Constructor Details

    • AccountDatabase

      public AccountDatabase()
      This is a non-parameterized constructor which creates an instance of Account class and initializes its data field with default values. Default size = 0 Default accounts array is an accounts array of initial capacity 5.

  • Method Details

    • find

      private int find​(Account account)
      find() is a method that iterates through the accounts array and returns the index of the parameterized account, if it exists in the array. If the account does not exist, it returns -1.
      Parameters:
      account - that we are trying to find in the accounts array
      Returns:
      index i if the account is in the accounts array, -1 if account cannot be found in array

    • grow

      private void grow()
      grow() increases the capacity of the accounts array by 5. First a new array of accounts is created with an additional length of five. Then the data values of current array account are transferred to the new array. Then the "accounts" data field is updated to point to the new array.

    • add

      public boolean add​(Account account)
      Add() is a method that adds the parameter account into the accounts array. It first finds the accounts index to ensure that the account does not already exist in the accounts array. In the case that the accounts array has reached its maximum size, the method grows the accounts array and increases its size by the capacity of 5. It then inserts the parameter account into the end of the accounts array.
      Parameters:
      account - that we are trying to add to our accounts array
      Returns:
      true if account was added, false if account cannot be found in accounts array

    • remove

      public boolean remove​(Account account)
      This method finds the account in the array. It return false if the account is not found. If the account is found at the last position and then it simply sets the last element to null, else it makes the element at the position point to the last element and then sets the last element to null. When an element is found and removed the size is reduced by 1 and true is returned.
      Parameters:
      account - to remove (Account account)
      Returns:
      true if account was found and hence successfully removed, false otherwise

    • deposit

      public boolean deposit​(Account account, double amount)
      deposit() is a method that adds a specific parameter amount to the parameterized account object. First, it checks to see if account is a part of the accounts array. If the account is not found, then we return false. Once the account is found, we add the specific amount to the accountâ€™s balance.
      Parameters:
      account - , which is the Account object we want to add an amount to
      amount - that we want to deposit (amount)
      Returns:
      true if deposit amount was added to account, false if account was not found and deposit amount cannot be added

    • withdrawal

      public int withdrawal​(Account account, double amount)
      This method tries the find the account in the array, and if the account is found then the balance is checked to see if it is sufficient for the withdrawal. If it is then the balance of that account is updated by decrementing it by the amount.
      Parameters:
      account - to withdraw from (Account account)
      amount - to withdraw from account (amount)
      Returns:
      -1 if account is not found, 1 if account does not have enough balance, 0 if account is found and has sufficient balance

    • exchangeAccount

      private static void exchangeAccount​(Account[] array, int index1, int index2)
      exchangeAccount() is a helper method that swaps two accounts in the accounts array using a standard swapping procedure.
      Parameters:
      array - of Accounts that we will take accounts to swap from
      index1 - of first account
      index2 - of second account

    • sortByDateOpen

      private void sortByDateOpen()
      sortByDateOpen() is a method that uses selection sort to find the earliest date, and arranges the accounts array in ascending order of dates.

    • sortByLastName

      private void sortByLastName()
      sortByLastName() sorts the accounts in the array of Accounts in ascending order of the last name of the holder. The selection sort algorithm is used.

    • printByDateOpen

      public void printByDateOpen()
      printByDateOpen() prints out the list of accounts in ascending order of their openDate. The list includes the string versions of the accounts, the monthly interest, monthly fee, and updated balance. Also, a call to this function ensures that the balance in all accounts are updated by increasing the value according to interest and decreasing the value according to the free. The call to printAccounts update is responsible for this functionality.

    • printbyLastName

      public void printbyLastName()
      printByLastName() prints out the list of accounts in ascending order of their last names. The list includes the string versions of the accounts, the monthly interest, monthly fee, and updated balance. Also, a call to this function ensures that the balance in all accounts are updated by increasing the value according to interest and decreasing the value according to the free. The call to printAccounts update is responsible for this functionality.

    • printAccounts

      public void printAccounts()
      printAccounts() prints out the string versions of all accounts in the accounts array data field.

    • printAccountsUpdate

      private void printAccountsUpdate()
      printAccountsUpdate() is a method that prints out all the accounts in the accounts array. For each account, it prints out: 1. The string version of the account 2. The monthlyInterest 3. The monthlyFee 4. The new monthly balance, which is the old monthly balance + monthlyInterest - monthlyFee Moreover, the balance of individual accounts is updated accordingly.
